intro: Gymnanthes boticario, commonly known as the Mexican beautyberry, is a shrub native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, bright purple berries that are highly ornamental. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are usually ovate to elliptic in shape. It produces fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers that are often clustered in terminal inflorescences. The berries are typically eaten by birds and mammals, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
